bridge-type.label: XMPP Client
bridge-type.description: A connection to an XMPP server

parameter.name: username
parameter.label: Username
parameter.description: The XMPP username (the left part of the JID, e.g., "user" for user@example.com)

parameter.name: nickname
parameter.label: Nickname
parameter.description: The XMPP nickname to use in multi-user chats (defaults to the username)

parameter.name: domain
parameter.label: Domain
parameter.description: The XMPP domain (the right part of the JID, e.g., example.com for user@example.com)

parameter.name: host
parameter.label: Server Hostname/IP
parameter.description: The IP address or hostname of the XMPP server (if not specified, the domain will be used)

parameter.name: securityMode
parameter.label: Security Mode
parameter.description: TLS security modes available when connecting to the XMPP server

channel-type.label: Publish Trigger
channel-type.description: This channel is triggered when a message is received on the configured XMPP account. The event payload will be the received text.

parameter.name: payload
parameter.label: Payload Condition
parameter.description: Optional condition on the payload value

parameter.name: separator
parameter.label: Separator Character
parameter.description: The trigger channel payload usually only contains the received text. If you define a separator character (e.g., '#'), the sender UID and received text will both be included. For example: "pavel@example.com#My Message Text".
